title.narrative: Central Asia Regional Economic Cooperation (CAREC) Regional Road Corridor Improvement Project (Supplementary)

description.narrative: The principal objectives of the project are to reduce transport costs and foster regional cooperation among PRC, Tajikistan and other Central Asian countries. The road will increase regional traffice and trade, improve access to regional markets and social services for people living along the Corridor.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Improved access to markets and social services

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Travel time between Sary Tash and Karamik reduced from 4 hours in 2009 to 2.5 hours by end-2012 (1.5 hour or 90 minutes time saving)

description.narrative: Improved access to markets and social services

title.narrative: Daily international freight traffic on the project road increases from about 10 trucks per day in 2006 to 120 trucks per day in 2015

description.narrative: Improved access to markets and social services

title.narrative: Agricultural, horticultural, and livestock production in the project area increases from 100,000 tons in 2006 to 160,000 tons in 2015.

description.narrative: Improved access to markets and social services

title.narrative: Traffic accidents on the Corridor reduces from 14 accidents per 250 AADT in 2006 to 14 per 750 AADT in 2015

description.narrative: Improved access to markets and social services

title.narrative: Domestic traffic on the project road increases from 250 AADT in 2006 to 750 AADT in 2015

description.narrative: Improved access to markets and social services

title.narrative: Number of children in the project area attending secondary school increases from 95% in 2007 to 99% in 2015

description.narrative: Improved access to markets and social services
